results.title: A Taste of Hong Kong
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International cookbook series”.
This video which has detailed demonstrations of traditional Chinese dishes and garnishes is interspersed with views of life in Hong Kong, particularly the markets, the restaurants and the harbour. It is divided into five sections: “Delights of the heart” which covers breakfasts and dim sum, “Treasures from the sea”, “Meat roasts”, “Food and festivals” and “Homecoming”. Demonstrated dishes include spare ribs en papillote, sauteed oysters with spring onion and ginger, roast pork and duck and spiced crispy chicken.

results.title: A Thousand acres
results.creator_credit: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Steve Golin, Marc Abraham, Via Rosa, Touchstone Pictures, Propaganda Films, Prairie Films, Buena Vista and Beacon Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in the Midwestern farm belt of the US, this meandering feminist melodrama is based on Jane Smiley’s novel which is itself an adaptation of Shakespeare’s “King Lear”. An aging patriarch (Jason Robards) decides impulsively to divide his prized thousand-acre farm between his three daughters but when the youngest (Jennifer Jason Leigh) tries to dissuade him, he disinherits her. When the other daughters (Jessica Lange, Michelle Pfeiffer) take up the offer, long repressed rivalries, unspoken secrets and regrets that both bind and divide the three women begin to surface. At the centre of the dysfunctional family dynamics is their controlling father, now rapidly declining into alcoholism and dementia. Written by Laura Jones.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jocelyn Moorhouse, Steve Golin, Marc Abraham, Via Rosa, Touchstone Pictures, Propaganda Films, Prairie Films, Buena Vista and Beacon Pictures

results.title: A Taste of France. - Volume 2. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara and International TV Consortium
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International cookbook series”.
Demonstrates a variety of French recipes prepared by regional chefs including Coq au vin, Coq au Riesling, Fricassee of Burgundy, Snails, Sauerkraut, Quiche Lorraine, Alsatian cheesecake, Pears Charlotte and Saddle of lamb.

results.title: A Taste of Hungary
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International cookbook series”.
This video looks at the cuisine and country of Hungary, once the centre of an empire. Dishes demonstrated include Pheasant soup, Pancakes with chocolate sauce, Matyos chicken soup and Saddle of lamb a la Palozen.

results.title: A Telephone call for Genevieve Snow
results.creator_credit: Peter Long, Beth Frey and Blackout Productions
results.brief_description: Genevieve Snow (Beth Buchanan) is a mousey piano teacher at a primary school ruled by a formidable headmistress, in this revisionist version of the Little Red Riding Hood fairytale based on a short story by Carmel Bird. One day as he is driving past the school, Nigel hears Genevieve being summoned over the public address system and decides to call her and through the series of elliptical phone conversations that follow, the pair strike up a strange relationship. Yet Genevieve’s lonely desperation and Nigel’s odd canine obsessions suggests their mutual attraction may have fatal consequences. Moody black and white photography emphasises these sinister undertones, yet the gothic atmosphere of this seemingly cautionary tale is shot through with a sense of the absurd, especially in relation to the claustrophobic rituals that enforce conventional roles. Cast also includes Damien Richardson, Esme Melville. Awards: Silver Lion for best short film in competition 57th Venice Film Festival 2000.

results.title: A Taxing woman's return
results.creator_credit: Juzo Itami, Yasushi Tamaoki and Itami Productions
results.brief_description: A follow uo to his comedy film “A Taxing woman”, Itami satirises the collapse of traditional values in Japan since World War II. Ryoko Hakura, the resourceful tax inspector inspired by the american “Colombo”, takes on the financial labyrinthe constructed by a jaded leader of a fraudulent religious cult collaborating with politicians, banks, big business; all held together by organised crime. This is a world peopled with “off-centre” characters who possess a gammut of short comings, cleverly satirised. The pace of the film is frantic; the plot, an intricate blend of comedy and action.
